title: Unspoken Rituals
description: The strange habits that define your true self

questions.question: When you walk into any new room, what's the first thing you actually do?

answers.text: Check all the exits and figure out escape routes before anything else
Touch the doorframe exactly three times with my fingertips
Look around to see who's watching me and what they're thinking
Find the corner or spot where I can see everything but stay hidden
Instantly adjust my whole personality to match what feels right for this space

questions.question: What's the one morning thing you absolutely cannot skip or your day feels wrong?

answers.text: Making sure nothing in my space has been moved or messed with overnight
Doing every single thing in the exact same order - if I mess up, I start over
Avoiding mirrors until I'm awake enough to control what I see in them
Checking if yesterday actually happened or if I dreamed the whole thing
Deciding which version of myself I need to be today

questions.question: When you're walking alone, you find yourself:

answers.text: Stepping in weird patterns - avoiding cracks, counting steps, following invisible rules
Walking like I'm in a movie and someone's watching me perform my life
Constantly changing my route so no one can predict my patterns
Counting my breaths or steps to stay connected to reality
Trying to become invisible, like I can just fade into the background

questions.question: Right before you fall asleep, you always:

answers.text: Check under my bed and in closets exactly three times, in the right order
Turn all objects so they're facing away from me - can't have them watching
Make mental backup copies of my day in case I don't wake up as me
Say goodbye to all the different versions of myself I was today
Test all the locks and windows multiple times until it feels right

questions.question: In the bathroom, you secretly:

answers.text: Never look at my reflection after midnight - something feels wrong about it
Run water to cover any sounds that might give away where I am
Count tiles or brush strokes in specific numbers that feel safe
Practice facial expressions and conversations for later
Talk to my reflection like it's a different person who needs instructions

questions.question: When you eat alone, you:

answers.text: Sit where I can't be seen through windows - eating makes you vulnerable
Arrange my food in patterns or eat things in a specific order
Keep one hand free and ready, never fully relax while eating
Pretend I'm someone else living a different life eating this meal
Stay standing or keep moving - sitting still while eating feels wrong

questions.question: Your phone habits include:

answers.text: Deleting messages right after reading them twice
Checking the same app exactly seven times before moving to the next one
Never saving contacts under real names - everyone gets a code
Writing long messages to people that I never actually send
Carefully managing what version of me people see online

questions.question: In elevators, you compulsively:

answers.text: Press your floor button exactly three times to make sure it worked
Stand in the exact center of the elevator - it feels mathematically right
Face the corner instead of the doors to avoid unwanted interaction
Hold my breath between floors to mark the transition between spaces
Study other people's micro-expressions and body language for data

questions.question: Your clothing rituals involve:

answers.text: Wearing at least one thing inside-out or backwards for protection
Never wearing the same outfit twice in the same social situation
Obsessively checking all my pockets for important items multiple times
Dressing as different characters depending on where I'm going
Choosing clothes that help me blend into backgrounds and disappear

questions.question: When you pass mirrors, you:

answers.text: Look away immediately - mirrors steal pieces of your soul
Check if my reflection is copying my movements correctly
Make the exact same gesture or expression every single time
Practice being someone else and see how convincing I look
Check if the person in the mirror recognizes me today

questions.question: Your workspace absolutely must have:

answers.text: Objects arranged in specific protective patterns that feel safe
Multiple escape routes planned and emergency protocols ready
Everything positioned to face specific directions that feel right
Hidden backup copies of important things in secret locations
Props and materials for different versions of myself

questions.question: During conversations, you unconsciously:

answers.text: Count their blinks and watch for signs they're lying
Mirror their body language and speech patterns exactly
Keep track of exits and potential escape routes the whole time
Watch myself from outside like I'm observing a performance
Count words or syllables in patterns to stay grounded

questions.question: In the shower, you:

answers.text: Never fully close my eyes - always keep partial vision
Wash every body part in the exact same order every time
Keep the curtain or door partially open for quick escape
Have entire conversations with people who aren't there
Time everything precisely - 30 seconds here, 45 seconds there

questions.question: Before entering your own home, you:

answers.text: Listen at the door for at least 30 seconds to detect any changes inside
Touch the doorknob or frame exactly three times before turning it
Mentally prepare and rehearse my 'home personality'
Scan for anything that looks different or out of place
Take a moment to remember who I'm supposed to be here

questions.question: Your secret food rituals involve:

answers.text: Eating everything in clockwise order around the plate
Never finishing the very last bite of anything
Eating while standing guard, ready to move at any moment
Pretending the food chose me instead of me choosing it
Arranging food into mathematical patterns before eating

questions.question: When you're completely alone at home, you:

answers.text: Check every room twice to confirm you're actually alone
Do secret movements and gestures that no one else knows about
Keep all doors either completely open or completely closed
Practice being your authentic self without any masks
Talk to yourself as multiple different people having conversations

questions.question: Your hand and finger rituals involve:

answers.text: Cracking knuckles in a specific mathematical sequence
Never showing the palms of my hands to strangers
Keeping hands partially clenched and ready for action
Touching objects to make them feel real and grounded
Making specific gestures that ward off negative energy

questions.question: In waiting rooms or public spaces, you:

answers.text: Sit where you can watch everyone while controlling access to yourself
Count ceiling tiles, floor patterns, or other repetitive elements
Never sit in the same spot twice in the same location
Practice becoming invisible and unnoticeable
Study other people to collect data on normal human behavior

questions.question: When you're anxious or stressed, your breathing:

answers.text: Follows strict mathematical counts: four in, hold seven, eight out
Matches the breathing patterns of others to blend in seamlessly
Becomes deliberately shallow to maintain hypervigilance
Changes for all my different selves to keep them alive
Creates specific rhythmic patterns that unlock calm states

questions.question: Your memory and information storage habits include:

answers.text: Writing important things exactly three times to make sure they stick
Creating false memories as decoys for real information
Memorizing exits and escape routes before anything else
Storing memories in imaginary rooms and locations in my mind
Separating information so no single version of me knows everything

questions.question: Before any important event or meeting, you:

answers.text: Rehearse every possible scenario and backup plan
Perform your personal protection ritual sequence
Choose which version of yourself to send while the real you stays safe
Accept that you might not return as the same person
Create detailed mental maps of the location and all variables

questions.question: When you walk, you unconsciously:

answers.text: Never step on cracks, lines, or specific patterns
Vary speed and direction to confuse potential followers
Walk as if I'm channeling someone else's movement style
Count steps in multiples of personally significant numbers
Move like I'm trying to leave no trace of my passage

questions.question: Your nighttime security check always includes:

answers.text: Testing whether objects have moved on their own during the day
Making sure all versions of yourself have returned home safely
Securing all possible entry points and invasion routes
Arranging objects in protective geometric formations
Confirming that today actually happened and wasn't imagined

questions.question: Your social media and online habits involve:

answers.text: Checking the same profiles in exactly the same order every time
Never posting your real thoughts, only carefully curated content
Creating false patterns and data to mislead anyone watching
Studying others to learn how to behave like a normal human
Maintaining multiple accounts for different versions of yourself

questions.question: Your deepest, most secret ritual that nobody else knows involves:

answers.text: Speaking to inanimate objects as if they're conscious entities watching you
Creating backup plans for your backup plans, nested infinitely deep
Performing small magical acts to protect yourself from unseen forces
Practicing dying and returning to prepare for the inevitable
Testing whether reality responds consistently to your private commands

traits.title: The Paranoid Ritualist
traits.description: Your rituals are sophisticated defense mechanisms against a world that's constantly monitoring you. Every pattern is protection, every repetition a ward against chaos. You've built an elaborate behavioral firewall that keeps the darkness at bay - or at least makes you feel in control.

traits.title: The Observer Ritualist
traits.description: Your rituals are research protocols for studying human behavior. You perform the sacred acts of 'normalcy' like an anthropologist studying an alien species - which, in a way, you are. Every gesture is calculated, every routine a performance based on careful observation.

traits.title: The Survivor Ritualist
traits.description: Your rituals are battle-tested survival mechanisms honed by years of threat assessment. Every behavior serves a tactical purpose: stay alert, stay ready, stay alive. You've turned existence into a series of defensive maneuvers, each ritual a checkpoint in your ongoing battle against chaos.

traits.title: The Ghost Ritualist
traits.description: Your rituals are desperate attempts to prove you exist in a world that seems to look right through you. Each repetitive action is an anchor to reality, a way to leave marks on a universe that treats you as optional. You perform ceremonies not for protection but for presence.

traits.title: The Cipher Ritualist
traits.description: Your rituals are an elaborate encryption system that only you can decode. Each behavior is part of a complex algorithm that transforms chaos into pattern, randomness into meaning. You've created your own reality with its own operational syntax, and your rituals are the programming language.
